description: {"blocks":[{"key":"f9m7u","text":"Multiple studies report that melanomas are innervated tumors with sensory and sympathetic fibers where these neural fibers play crucial functional roles in tumor growth and metastasis with branch specificity. Yet there is no study which reports the direct neural recording and its pattern during in-vivo progression of the cancer. We performed daily neural recordings from male and female mice bearing orthotopic metastasizing-melanomas and melanomas with low metastatic poential, derived from B16-F10 and B16-F1 cancer cells, respectively. Further, to explore the origins of neural activity, 6-Hydroxidopamine mediated chemical sympathectomy was performed followed by daily microneurographic recordings. We also performed the daily bioluminescent imaging to track in vivo growth of primary tumors and distant metastasis to the cranial area. The protocols contained herein describe the methods, materials and equipment used to accomplish this research.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bhvv8","text":"Store the vials containing cells in liquid nitrogen vapor until they are ready for use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"56efs","text":"Thaw in a 37°C water bath, then decontaminate by dipping in or spraying with 70% ethanol. All of the operations from this point on will be carried out under strict aseptic conditions. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fjk61","text":"Add vial contents to a complete culture medium, and then centrifuge at approximately 125 x g for 5 to 7 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":91,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bfbgs","text":"Add the cell pellet to the recommended complete medium. Medium: DMEM, 10% FBS, 1% Penicillin-Streptomycin ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"24e6v","text":"Incubate the culture at 37°C in a suitable incubator at proper CO2 exposure: 5% CO2 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":65,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":82,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4cesm","text":"Renew medium every 2- 3 days: remove and discard old medium. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bagag","text":"Rinse cell layer with 1X PBS ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9t100","text":"Add 2.0 to 3.0 mL of Trypsin solution to 75cm3 flask and observe cells under an inverted microscope until the cell layer is dispersed (usually within 15 minutes). Corning‱ T-75 flasks (catalog #430641) are recommended for subculturing this product.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":45,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":170,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":170,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"509B65242F2511EFB98B0A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5bit1","text":"Add 6.0 to 8.0 mL of complete growth medium and aspirate cells by gently pipetting","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45vrt","text":"Add appropriate aliquots of the cell suspension to new culture vessels.  Cultures can be established between 2 x 104 and 4 x 104 viable cells/cm2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":115,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":127,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":144,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ar9vc","text":"Incubate cultures at 37°C and 5% CO2 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":35,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ndsc","text":"Passage cells at least twice after thawing and before inoculation, but no more than 30 times total per cell\nline. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ov04","text":"Under isoflurane anesthesia (2%, 1L/min), each mouse underwent a subcutaneous injection with 5 x 105 cells to the flank area. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":99,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eeglh","text":"Chemical sympathectomy solution was prepared by dissolving 6-hydroxydopamine (6-OHDA, 100 mg/kg body weight) in sterile saline along with 0.01% of ascorbate as a stabilizer.   2 mL of buffer per 5 mg vial provides a solution containing 10 mM 6-hydroxydopamine and 0.01% (w/v) ascorbic acid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aeth","text":"On the fourth (Day = -4) and second day (Day = -2) before cancer cell inoculation (Day = 0), the drug was injected intraperitoneally (IP) using an insulin syringe. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2skb0","text":"After these two initial injections, the drug was administered IP every five days to maintain the sustained effect of denervation. (i.e. Day = +5, +10, +15, etc)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4t20t","text":"Neural recordings were performed for thirty minutes for each day under 2% isoflurane in 1 L/min oxygen, for two weeks starting from day 6 post inoculation of cancer cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4cbej","text":"Microneurography needles were inserted into the primary tumor mass and a ground/reference needle was inserted on the contralateral side.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4kilg","text":"By using a micromanipulator, the needles were inserted at the same depth (5 mm) and same distance apart (4 mm), daily, in order to record from the same location. The two recording needles were fixed to a holder and were maintained at a 4 mm separation distance. The holder was mounted on a 1µm, x-y-z resolution micromanipulator system, so that the daily insertion depth could be repeated with certainty. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b9h16","text":"The neural data were sampled at 20 kHz and filtered from 500 Hz to 1200 Hz using a 7th order, zero-phase, digital bandpass filter.\nADInstruments amplifier (FE285) was used for all the recordings. Recorded neural data were displayed and stored in Lab Chart files. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fvl4f","text":"Lab Chart files were exported into MATLAB (RRID:SCR_001622) compatible files.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ectvv","text":"The results were quantified in terms of number of spikes per file using UltraMegaSort2000 (UMS2000) spike sorting program (2) and neural spikes were plotted for ten minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0lsl","text":"The averaged spike count per 10 minutes, was plotted as a function of days post inoculation of cancer cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6opa9","text":"Images were acquired using Perkin-Elmer’s In-Vivo Imaging System (IVIS) Spectrum at 60s exposure. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f8qv3","text":"Under isoflurane anesthesia (2% at 1L/min), 200 µL of D-luciferin solution (12.5 mg/ml of D-luciferin in sterile phosphate buffer solution) was injected IP using an insulin syringe ten minutes before acquiring the images. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2gp1","text":"Total flux was quantified from the primary tumor region in order to quantify the in-vivo growth, as well as from the cranial region to quantify the growth of secondary metastatic foci. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ac55n","text":"Same sized regions of interest (ROIs) were used for the images with the same Field of View (FOVs) for a particular day of imaging.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"qce4","text":"At day 10 post-inoculation, under isoflurane anesthesia (2%, 1L/min) the mice were perfused via intracardiac perfusion first using 20 mL of 1X Phosphate Buffered Saline (PBS) solution followed by 20 mL of 4% Paraformaldehyde (PFA) solution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4j4o9","text":"The excised tumor tissues were then transferred to paraformaldehyde and refrigerated at 4°C for 24 to 48 hours. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8b66c","text":"After fixing in paraformaldehyde, the samples were immersed in a 15% sucrose solution with 1X PBS for 24 hours at 4°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1td5","text":"Then, they were moved to a 30% sucrose 1X PBS solution and kept at 4°C until processing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9qfes","text":"The samples were formalin-fixed and paraffin-embedded, and 5μm thick slices were subjected to immunohistochemistry chromogenic detection using neurofilament primary antibody (NF, RRID: Thermo Fisher 2F11; TH, RRID: Sigma-Aldrich AB152) to detect the presence of nerve fibers and autonomic nerves, respectively. {"blocks":[{"key":"ak9pe","text":"To obtain a comprehensive pathological understanding of the tumor microenvironment, slices were obtained from various tumor areas, ranging from about 100 μm. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"372m7","text":"The neurofilament immunohistochemical (IHC) staining process was conducted as follows:","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":86}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3alrn","text":"Neurofilament Protocol:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"uj14","text":"Involved in the maintenance of neuronal caliber, neurofilaments are the intermediate filament proteins found specifically in neurons, and are composed predominantly of three major proteins called NF-L, NF-M and NF-H. Like most other intermediate filament proteins (IFPs), the expression of the different neuronal IFPs is both tissue-specific and developmentally regulated. NF-L is the light or low molecular weight microfilament subunit and runs on SDS-PAGE gels at approximately 70 kDa. Neurofilament are the 10nm or intermediate filament proteins found specifically in neurons, and are composed predominantly of three major proteins called NF-L, NF-M and NF-H. NF-H is the heavy or high molecular weight microfilament subunit and runs on SDS-PAGE gels in the range 180-220 kDa, with some variation in different species.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fu3ev","text":"The tyrosine hydroxylase (TH) immunohistochemical (IHC) staining process was conducted as follows:","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":98}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bjhch","text":"Tyrosine Hydroxylase plays an important role in the physiology of adrenergic neurons. It is the first and rate-limiting enzyme involved in the biosynthesis of the catecholamines Dopamine and Norepinephrine from tyrosine. TH is, therefore, a useful marker for dopaminergic and noradrenergic neurons. The enzymatic activity of TH requires ferrous ions as cofactors and is believed to be regulated by phosphorylation. At least four isoforms of human TH have been identified which result from alternative splicing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":20,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
